Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The White Countess" and "Where the Heart Is". Both movies are based on real-life stories of women who have overcome significant challenges in their lives.
"The White Countess" is a historical drama film that tells the story of an American diplomat named Tip Douglas who travels to China in 1930s. During his stay in China, he develops a curious relationship with a young Russian refugee named Ida Ivanova who works odd--and sometimes illicit--jobs to support members of her dead husband' s aristocratic family.
"Where the Heart Is" is a romantic drama film that tells the story of a pregnant seventeen- year- old named Samantha Johnson who rebuilds her life after being abandoned by her boyfriend at a Walmart in Sequoyah, Oklahoma. During her stay in town, she develops a curious relationship with a local mechanic named Jake Taylor who helps her get back on her feet.
Both movies are well-produced and directed, and they feature strong performances from their casts.
